DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Unit Identifier Same ISBT-128 Donation Identification Number Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not umbilical cord blood unit identifier number is also the ISBT-128 donation identification number.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Unit Identifier Same ISBT-128 Donation Identification Number
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder._A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing._Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree._A globally unique identifier that is assigned to each collection and each pooled product. The identifier is composed of four parts: a Facility Identification Number (FIN), a year of assignment, a serial number, and flag characters.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:Any division of quantity accepted as a standard of measurement or exchange.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Property.preferredDefinition: Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree. :A globally unique identifier that is assigned to each collection and each pooled product. The identifier is composed of four parts: a Facility Identification Number (FIN), a year of assignment, a serial number, and flag characters.

Concepts.definition: Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree.

A globally unique identifier that is assigned to each collection and each pooled product. The identifier is composed of four parts: a Facility Identification Number (FIN), a year of assignment, a serial number, and flag characters.
